hero.title: Bilingual coaching for UK-based transitions
hero.subtitle: ICF-aligned coaches fluent in English and Traditional Chinese, attuned to UK workplaces and Chinese cultural rhythms. We partner with mid-career professionals, returners, newcomers, and graduates to design small experiments that move you forward.

audiencesIntro: We coach people who are rebuilding direction in the UK while holding onto their own cultural wisdom. Each partnership blends reflective space with practical experiments you can test safely.

audiences.title: Mid-career professionals
audiences.description: Pause the noise of relocation or role changes, clarify what a sustainable next chapter looks like, and prototype it step by step.

audiences.title: Returners after a career break
audiences.description: Re-enter work with bilingual support that honours your pace, rebuilds confidence, and sets up routines you can test at home and in the office.

audiences.title: Newcomers to the UK
audiences.description: Translate between British workplace norms and Chinese cultural expectations while choosing actions that fit your values.

audiences.title: Recent graduates
audiences.description: Turn uncertainty into small experiments—from informational chats to role trials—that help you learn before you leap.

processIntro: Our ICF-aligned approach keeps you in the lead. Sessions can flow in English, Traditional Chinese, or both, and each step focuses on small experiments that build evidence for your decisions.

process.title: Fit conversation
process.description: A 20-minute bilingual chat to understand your context, language preferences, and what support feels respectful for you.

process.title: Coaching cycles
process.description: 4–6 sessions of 50–60 minutes where you choose the focus. We listen, reflect, and co-design experiments grounded in ICF competencies.

process.title: Review and sustain
process.description: We harvest learning, adjust experiments, and plan what rhythm of support you want next—whether that’s continued coaching or self-led check-ins.

faqIntro: Here’s how we keep coaching ethical, culturally aware, and practical for the transitions you’re navigating.

faqs.question: What does ICF-aligned coaching look like here?
faqs.answer: We work to the International Coaching Federation Code of Ethics: you stay in charge of the agenda, we design clear agreements, and every tool or observation is used with your permission.

faqs.question: Which languages can we use?
faqs.answer: We coach in English and Traditional Chinese, switching whenever it helps you express nuance or process cultural context.

faqs.question: Do you give advice?
faqs.answer: We stay non-directive. When useful, we may offer reflections or frameworks, and you decide how to adapt them into your experiments.

faqs.question: How many sessions will we plan?
faqs.answer: Many clients begin with 4–6 sessions. We review progress frequently and you choose whether to extend, pause, or conclude.

faqs.question: Is coaching the same as therapy or counselling?
faqs.answer: No. Coaching is forward-looking and doesn’t diagnose or treat. If therapy seems more suitable, we will signpost other services respectfully.

faqs.question: What happens between sessions?
faqs.answer: We agree on small experiments or reflections you will try. You own the actions; we meet again to learn from what happened.

founders.title: Who you'll meet
founders.subtitle: Co-founders who bridge UK and Chinese contexts with ICF-aligned coaching, facilitation, and design thinking.

people.name: Hao-Cheng Tsai
people.bio: Connects systems thinking with cultural transitions so your experiments stay grounded in real constraints.

people.name: Yi-Ling Lai
people.bio: Holds calm, bilingual space for career clarity, values exploration, and confidence that sticks beyond each session.
